examples: the limestones of the Jurassic age are condensed into a mere 11 feet

verb.description: Change or cause to change from a gas or vapor to a liquid.
examples: the moisture vapor in the air condenses into droplets of water
the cold air was condensing his breath

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French condenser or Latin condensare, from condensus very thick, from con- completely + densus dense.
